abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory on
            balance, with qualifications. While not entirely clear as a
            control issue, this report's authors believe that
            government agencies emerging from a decade of centralized
            government, macro-economic instabiity, and a post-conflict
            environment had varying degrees of difficulty
            acting/reacting with the technical and administrative
            agility and skill required by the project. A critical issue
            beyond Government control was the large number of claims for
            indemnifications from US citizens , for lands lost during
            the conflict in 1979 and its aftermath, representing a
            fiscal and political burden and a huge obstacle for land
            regularization. Project sustainability is rated likely
            because of renewed support by IDA, and because follow-up
            initiatives are building upon this project's
            achievements. world Bank overall performance was on balance
            satisfactory but mixed. Borrower peformance overall was
            satisfactory.Bank requirements, seen by the Borrower as
            onerous on occasion, nevertheless served an important
            function of transferring knowledge/technology to borrower
            agencies concerning the standards, actions, and practices
            needed to execute complex programs; and its instutional
            performance--albeit uneven within and between
            agencies--improved significantly over time. Other lessons
            learned pertain to monitoring outputs and impacts,
            collaboration between disparate institutions, and the legal
            environment for land titling, especially women's land tenure.
